intro: Reseda quartiniana, commonly known as the red sandras, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other well-known plants such as cabbage and mustard. The plant is characterized by its erect, branching stems and clusters of small, yellow flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture. Reseda quartiniana is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments.
